rationale: Explicitly states “Administered 25 mg of long-acting risperidone in the patient’s right arm.”
No mention of moving furosemide dose to 10 a.m. or stated goals.
Includes dizziness and ringing in ears but omits emotional distress reference to shoes/water pill.
“Ordered baseline ECG and electrolytes” captured verbatim.
Conditional KCl 20 mEq after supper if K<4 mEq/L documented exactly.
Instructions to aides about stand-by assist, slow position changes, and daily BP recording all present.
States next injection day 28 and dose reduction trigger if >2 naps.
Notes ongoing hallucinations but lacks patient’s request to advance injection and clinician explanation.
Records QT concern and plan for daily pulse checks & weekly ECG; omits reassurance of low risk.
No documentation of grandson interpreter or nurse witness.
Medication list with timing not included at all.
Major decisions captured, but several key elements (furosemide change, interpreter, med list) missing.
No new unsupported clinical content added.
Does not add irrelevant chart history or meds.
No obvious fabricated patient or clinician statements detected.
